## b) 

Summarize the data, i.e., % of pixels for the different classes. Plot well-labeled
beautiful maps using x, y coordinates the expert labels with color of the region based
on the expert labels. Do you observe some trend/pattern? Is an i.i.d. assumption for the samples justified for this dataset?

```{r cache=TRUE}
# loading data 
img1 = data.frame(read.table("image_data/imagem1.txt"))
img2 = data.frame(read.table("image_data/imagem2.txt"))
img3 = data.frame(read.table("image_data/imagem3.txt"))

# name the columns  
col_names = c("y", "x", "label", "NDAI", "CD", "CORR", "DF","CF","BF","AF","AN")
colnames(img1) = col_names
colnames(img2) = col_names
colnames(img3) = col_names

img1$label = as.factor(img1$label)
img2$label = as.factor(img2$label)
img3$label = as.factor(img3$label)
```

```{r}
# plotting 
# first cloud image 
ggplot(img1, aes(x=x, y=y)) + 
  geom_point(aes(colour = label)) +
  labs(title = "Image 1 With Expert Labels",
          subtitle = "-1: No Cloud, 0 : Uncertain; 1 : Cloud")

# second cloud image 
ggplot(img2, aes(x=x, y=y)) + 
geom_point(aes(colour = label)) +
labs(title = "Image 1 With Expert Labels",
        subtitle = "-1: No Cloud, 0 : Uncertain; 1 : Cloud")

# third cloud image 
ggplot(img3, aes(x=x, y=y)) + 
  geom_point(aes(colour = label)) +
  labs(title = "Image 1 With Expert Labels",
          subtitle = "-1: No Cloud, 0 : Uncertain; 1 : Cloud")
```
